column4: Hello folks! I recently installed Ubuntu Breezy 5.10 in an old laptop (Pentium II 233MHz) and I have an RT2500 802.11g PCMCIA wireless card plugged in. I wish I could install kernel modules to activate my card... How can I do that?
You need to make sure there is a drive for your card for linux.
yes, I know there is a driver because I used this card on Kanotix and Knoppix
Great, did you download the drive?
nop... I have no network in that computer. For that I want to install that card... I wish I could get driver from Ubuntu CD... Is that possible?
oh! sorry... Ubuntu detected my card! :-) Great! I saw that doing a "iwconfig"... I see "ra0".. Now I need to know how to configure ESSID, and those things to connect to my Access Point
